description:
Simply put, the best neighborhood bar in the city. Rotating beer taps for your beer snob in the group, well poured cocktails for the stumbler in your group, always right music vibes for the dancer in your group, and take it or leave it vibes for the hipster of your group. 

The owner Tom is focused on providing an open and engaging atmosphere for all and the people behind the bar have personality for days. If you don't like coming here you probably got lost in the mission and meant to be at Almanac taproom with the rest of your Marina friends.
author: Andrew M.

description: An awesome post-night shift bar. Opens at 6am. All of the nurses from SFGH come here to reconnect after a busy night. Lots of laughs and good times.
author: SF Native M.

description: I saw FunCheap list their emo/pop-punk night as a fun free activity(2nd Saturday of month). I hadn't been to this dive bar before in the Mission. I hadn't heard of it, but I have been going out to bars like Bender's and Knockout with people. Those are alternative dives in the Mission. I had a virgin bloody Mary and actually that was my first bloody Mary. It's tomato juice with spices and a different flavor. You gotta do the photo booth. Note: It's $3 and you pay with credit card. It's spits out two copies and you gotta sit still quickly and take 3 pics. The outside looks old, but it's modern inside. It's digital. The emo/pop-punk night music is okay, but they didn't spin any major hits by major emo bands that you would instantly recognize and just feel excited about. There isn't a visible DJ. We had fun at this bar. My friend said he would go there again. It's alternative with a young crowd, but there's no single lifestyle look. On 24th Street.
author: Denise C.

description:
If you're a 90's kid like myself then you will absolutely LOVE their monthly party here called CUFFIN' ..I believe it's the last Friday of the month!

When you can drink and vibe to music from Aaliyah, Toni Braxton, Mobb Deep, and all your hip hop/r&b faves....you have a party for me!
author: Laurie V.

description:
This is probably the best bar in San Francisco right now, particularly between the hours of 5 and 9.  At least it was last night, when there was a DJ playing old-timey big band-type jazz that reminded my friends and I of the "Grandpa's Naptime" playlist that used to be on Songza (and is now on Google Play, as I just learned).  He (the DJ) was an older dude who had a long gray beard and tattoos and let's just say that nobody was gonna tap him on the shoulder and say "excuse me, can you please play some hip hop"?  

Then at 9 PM that DJ left and it became "Emo Night" and I lasted about 5 minutes before I was punching myself in the face repeatedly.  But I'm still giving Pop's 5 star because it's amazing.
author: Jacob K.

description: One word - CUFFIN. I was quite stoked about the music they were playing. Cuffin Fridays are every last Friday of the month and are hands down fun! Music is mostly r&b/hip hop, which is awesome. They have a photobooth too! Restrooms are covered in tags/graffiti, which I think calls for a good photo op. Prices are reasonable. Parking isn't horrible. The staff are super friendly. How could you go wrong?? Definitely wouldn't mind coming back here.
author: Tracy P.

description:
Pops is pretty poppin..
Neighborhood bar with always good music and some rad dj nights. 
What I love is that if you're looking for a low key bar but that's genuinely not just your average swashbuckling place, this is where you go. 
Keep the mission alive.
author: Hannah M.

description: Bloody Mary Review - You Can't go wrong with the motto "Life is short. Drink early." Pop's Bar hosts Rise & Shine, the city's longest happy hour, from 6am 7pm. Yes, that means you'll enjoy a whopping thirteen hours of happiness filled with Bacon Bloody Marys, Irish Coffees, Mexican Coffees, fresh OJ mimosas and more. So kick back, relax, and keep that day drunk going. Why go? Variety. | Price: $8
author: Shelley B.

description: Laid back, old-school, sf dive bar that is also part of the beer passport program. Nothing really too special here, and that's exactly why this place is special. Good beers on tap and knowledgable staff. Perhaps things aren't as pretty when it gets busier here, but I had a great time around 7p, and they didn't even mind if I brought in food from outside.  Thank you for a great discovery.
author: Brian J.

description: Preety cool neighborhood bar in the mission I would rather goto the jay n bee but this is also sf history.  It's really dark inside of here but the bar has a cool lay out.  Only been a couple times and I probably wouldn't mind going back again.
author: Mark P.

description: My favorite place in the mission!! So chill and reminds me of any local dive bar. Bartender & bouncer definitely need raises - so personable  highly recommended. Love, Mamá
author: Licely C.

description:
So I walked into this bar with a stank attitude-- partly because I was tired but mostly because I didn't realize TBB (Tech Basic Bitch or Behavior if you don't use "swear words") had sunk so deep in my DNA.  

Timeline of basic thoughts below:

Upon getting out of the Lyft (clearly protesting Uber-- ref: TBB): "Who is this absolutely kind bouncer greeting me with a smile?"

Upon entering: "Why aren't ppl huddled together like cattle while on their phones?" Why is the owner being so nice to my friends? Wait, why is he being so nice to everyone?"

Navigating the crowd: "How come I don't have to say excuse me 50 million times before someone looks up from their phone and moves 2inches?" 

Ordering drinks: "Where is my craft cocktail menu with ingredients I can't pronounce? Why is this bartender not giving me a side-eye for asking for Kettle One and soda? Why is this drink so reasonably priced?"

DJ: "Wait they're not playing house/EDM music?Oh whoa... It's just regular 90s music that we can all enjoy.WAIT...They have karaoke....someone just chose California Love...Are we in Oakland?"

This place woke me. Sure, it has its share of hipsters(sup gentrification, how you doing?) but if you want to check your TBB level just enter this spot and be mindful of your thoughts. You'll see how pretentious you may have become and if you're anything close to an evolved human, you'll call yourself out, grab a non-craft cocktail, and sing your heart out to Tupac, Selena, and Beyonce.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description: Awesome dive!! Bartender Charlie is amazing! And SUPER dog friendly!!!!!!!!!!!!@#$&()*&%#!@$&(&^#!$&((&#@^((^$#^*(
author: Sheree B.

description: My companions and I loved the music the DJ was playing, the look of the place and the beer selection.  But when I ordered my beer, it was super loud and the bartender misunderstood something I had said.  I told him I had the beer passport, and that three of us had them.  He proceeded to pour three of the beer I ordered, which I did not notice because I was frantically searching for the right page in my passport.  I was surprised to see the three pints and he insisted that I had ordered them.  Finally, he looked at me exasperated and poured out the other two.  It's an honest mistake, but really left me with a bad feeling to be told that I said something I did not say.
author: Renee C.

description: Always great times. Bartenders with Warm smiles, always rememberEd your. Name. Rip Calib.
author: James W.

description: Love this bar! Charlie is my absolute favorite bartender! He is so friendly, and makes a delicious Bloody Mary. Only downside is Sadderdays. Stay away, unless u brought your eyeliner wrist bands and Jimmy eat world tee shirts
author: Es B.

description: The go to! They have really fun themed nights and cool neon lights outside and inside the bar. They also have a great live DJ playing records. I definitely go to Pops very often as it's my neighborhood dive. Their drinks are also really delicious and a great price!
author: J J.

description:
I imagine that there are some polarized opinions when it comes to the newly renovated Pop's.  In San Francisco, and especially in The Mission, the debate over gentrification is practically as heated as debates about religion in the 1500's.  Granted, we don't see much burning at the stake, but you rarely find opinions that are not pretty set on one side or the other.  Most will either welcome the changes to Pop's or despise them.  

"Pop's, Before":  I came exactly one time.  It was 12:30pm on a Saturday.  I was a bit hung-over (Maybe a bit more than a bit) and had to use the bathroom.  Those were the only reasons I stopped in:  Hangover Remediation and a Bathroom.  This was a Super-Divey place.  Dark, dank, rough around the edges.  I probably wouldn't have stayed for more that my Pit-Stop and one Cheap Beer, but (see the original review) I found out that people actually put Bacon in Bloody Mary's.  I won't lie - for all the dark-ness and dank-ness, for all "go-the-f-back-to-suburbia" this place had to offer... They crushed the Bloody.  This thing was killer.

"Pop's, After":  If the sign on the door hadn't said Pop's when I walked in, there is no way I would have believed this was the same place.  The place has been turned classy.  It's like Rocker Tommy Lee turned into Realtor Phil Dunphy.  It's now a nice, although not super-pretentious, neighborhood bar.  You can take a look at the new photos - if you remember what it once looked like, you'll be stunned.  They still had the Bacon Bloody, but it wasn't quite the same.  Again, check out my photo vs. some of the originals from "Pop's, Before".  The service was nice, the crowd was not much different than a place like R Bar in the Tendernob (yeah yeah, I know some of you think that place is much more fratty than it really is, a la Wreck Room).  

So, what is the real analysis?  Was it better to have the edgy, divey, f-the-squares joint?  Is it better to have another perfectly affable spot with daylight and nice finishes?   We've endured another Neil Young to Neil Diamond transformation.  But, such is life in SF.  I don't know what the answer is, but I know in SF that this is something that is a fact of life, writ large.  For what it's worth, I think they did a nice job.  Had I not known "Pop's, Before", I would have found this to be a nicely-finished neighborhood spot that was friendly and had good service.  But, there is a little something in my "go-the-f-back-to-suburbia" soul that reminds me that eventually, suburbia can swallow you up and turn you into everyone else.  And trust me, I grew up in Golden Valley, Minnesota.

If there's a moral of the story, it's that times change.  Often times progress is good - but it is worth thinking about what won't be anymore.  Some of the change is colored by nostalgia.  But, I wonder what exactly we lose...
author: Adam S.

description:
I ended up at Pop's Bar late on a Friday night a couple weeks back, arriving just in time for a drink before closing. The place was fun, not too busy with an easy ambiance and friendly service. I guess it's a dive bar? But like a nice dive bar for young San Francisco professionals. Craft beer, photo booth, white people.

I was already pretty tired/tanked when we arrived, so I just had a beer and took some photo booth pictures as a nightcap. It was great! Drank a Deschutes Armory XPA and the photo booth pictures were appropriately ridiculous. I don't know that I'd seek out/recognize Pop's Bar again, but I had a good time here and would recommend it for a drink in the Mission.
author: Steph C.

description:
This a real hipster bar.  Tons of kids dancing all over the floor.  And I spotted a few people of a more mature age.  Kudos for the creative mixed drinks.  I didn't get one because they are so pricey.  Stuck with a stoat beer for $6 vs. $12 cocktail.  

Really fun bathroom with all the R rated pictures all over the walls.  Oooolala!  Men with mustache handles wearing only that.  LOL.  Super retro.  I heard the men's bathroom has a bunch of women on their wall.  My gay friend wasn't into that.

Music can get super loud here.  Great once the booze kicks in.  For me I wasn't on that level.  So I just danced standing.
author: Michelle M.

description: My favorite spot for as long as I can remember! Pops holds a special place in my heart but besides that the bloody marys are to die for!
author: Melanie H.

description:
I was going to say Pop's Bar has a dingier and grittier feel to it when I realized that it was fairly recently renovated so I can only imagine how much more "authentic" it must have felt before. 

This is a quintessentially unapologetic dive bar. You do real drinking here. It's not the fanciest of environments but it feels comfortable. Even more so with a pint in hand and some good conversation. We definitely weren't the regulars when we popped in but it never felt awkward as we drank a couple of rounds. Pretty reasonable prices too.

In a city that is changing on a dime before our eyes, I'm glad that stalwarts like Pop's remain to remind us of its eclectic history.
author: Jon L.

description:
Best hidden gem.  We entertain a lot.  We are native SFers and people ask us all the time where to eat, listen to music, what hotel to stay...etc. My husband and I both agreed, we were not going to tell anyone we know about this place.  It's our place to hang. Old school, nice mix of SF crowd. DJs with diverse selection to go with diverse SF patrons. (Even old school music and Latin grooves! What?!). And enough TVs and a big screen in the back to watch Warriors, Giants, Sharks and Niners. Oh and a small dance floor where the big screen is. (We came here the night Prince passed away. They played his music and videos all night!)  

Lastly and very important- we have experienced 2 male bartenders, I think one was named Justin and another day it was a guy with glasses who played hockey (we didn't ask he noticed we were watching Sharks game and started a nice conversation and engaged kindly with us).  Very cool bartenders and professional!  Work fast, clean and know how to serve drinks well. Even down to the fresh lime wiped on the rim and salted on the rim of a cold draft Pacifico!! It wasn't just table salt too, it was a seasoned salt.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Leilani I.

description:
My friend works here so obviously I'm biased, but I still wanted to write a review because I talk a lot and you should listen. 

Pop's isn't exactly a "dive" bar according to my standards, but more of a chill local's bar full of an eclectic mix of people.

I was just visiting San Franciso this past weekend and came to Pop's once on Friday night, once Sunday afternoon and then again on Sunday night. Each time I was there I saw some of the same people lingering around but then also a wide range of other folks young and old. Bros, hipsters, crusty looking punks and then just your everyday neighborhood alcoholics. It was never so crowded that you couldn't find a seat, but still enough people to have an interesting evening of it. 

Drinks are strong and cheap and they make a perfect Bloody Mary (with bacon!).

They have some table games and a juke box in the back along with plenty of seating and a couple booths up at the front right under the windows. 

Definitely check this place out if you're in the Mission, I loved it here regardless of my friend working here. Also, they allow dogs inside!
author: Ashley K.

description: Friendly bartenders, inexpensive drinks, cool dive bar decor and a photo booth.. enough said. Definitely a locals scene, and you can hear yourself talk bc it isn't crazy loud.
author: Caro S.

description:
Came here on a random night.

Enjoyed some hefty pours of whisky, enjoyed 80s songs, and scored on FRONT PARKING!!!

I was hoping for the photo booth to work that it wasn't. Other than that, thanks POPS!
author: Jay B.

description:
I agree 100% with Adam S' review from November 2014. Change is "good", as everyone either adapts or rejects and sides form. 

Old Pop's was the definition of a dive bar. New Pop's retains some character and adds more options to the equation. I'm sure the fact I'm writing a review for Pop's in itself is ironic to the owners. 

I don't mind either way, as Pop's is my soon-to-be-go-to neighborhood (quite the hyphenation) bar. Just keep games on the TV's and relatively cheap booze flowing. And photo booths are always fun.
author: Peter C.

description: The place is exactly what you want in a neighborhood bar...good, reasonably  priced drinks, awesome bartender (shout out to Tom)...chill people sitting around the bar...no food, but a great little taqueria acted the street in case you get the munchies. They're totally cool with you bringing in food. Good spot to watch the game.
author: Anne R.

description: Sometimes the sports vibe is more than I like. Sometimes it's not as artsy as I imagine myself and my neighborhood to be. And yet it is always welcoming and always has the comforting vibe of a local dive bar, my favorite kind.
author: Kokoe J.

description: I highly recommend the Marge Simpson! It's basically a margarita made with Jalapeño infused tequila with Tajin on the rim instead of salt. Our bartender Nick gave us a shot to taste the tequila and it was absolutely fantastic.
author: Raul T.

description: Pops is a good spot, saw some good live music here on sat night and the crowd is a lot less hipster than other bars nearby,  good spot, strong drinks.
author: christopher h.

description: I am so glad Pop's is open again. So good to have a neighborhood bar in the 24th and Potrero area again. The owners remodeled the place and it looks great. The bar staff is very friendly and the prices are great.
author: Alex C.

description: I liked it more when it felt like a meth bar.  Not that I'm into meth, but it felt like a more interesting experience when it was a shit hole.  They took out the pinball machines & changed the bloody mary recipe post-remodel.  Now it gets a resounding meh from me.
author: Chris S.

description:
Dive bar in the Mission with the expected interesting characters. 

The place has a vintage style photo booth in the back, so that gets a thumbs up in my book. The booth is covered in graffiti and stickers, plus smells like farts inside, but hey, it is in working condition.

The beers are reasonably priced. 

Other notes: people openly belch, unexplained dollars glued to the ceiling, velvet cat artwork, etc.
author: Tony D.

description: All fancy now and less bro.I kinda miss the bro,though.Was that poetic? The bartender I had Sunday made me a tequila press and it was so awesome I had like 4.HAMMERTIME!
author: Lauren V.

description: Divey and fun, I found this place because I was seeing an SF Sketchfest show across the street at the Brava Theater. Ended up having drinks at Pop's before and after the show.
author: Marcus L.

description:
I ventured into Pops this afternoon after brunching at the St Francis Fountain across the street.  Upon entering, I was immediately struck by the low lighting and dingy feel of the bar. All was soon forgotten when my Bloody Mary arrived with a strip of bacon, a pickles asparagus, a pickled green bean, and a pepper.  This was a whole meal in a glass, and I couldn't be happier.

The bartender was great and was incredibly friendly.  My friends were planning a visit to Milwaukee (her hometown), and she happily produced a long list of places to visit while in town.
author: Brad C.

description:
Ken the bouncer is a chill guy. The drinks are good, the vibe is nice.

Only complaint: cheesy music.
author: Jeanine O.

description:
To quote another who put it better: new Pop's is like gazing into the face of a beloved old friend who's had a bunch of drastic, awful plastic surgery done. Just heartbreaking through and through. My previous review was entirely for old Pop's, and none of that remains. I wish they'd just given the new bar a new name, so I wasn't constantly reminded of a different place that's long gone. 

The drinks are now overpriced, there's a bunch of hacky "look at our history, look how long we've been here, it's so long, we swear!" stuff on the walls, the live music is deeply cheesy, and the community that had formed around the place is entirely scattered. Best of luck to new Pop's, but I'll never go back.
author: Tea B.

description: Went here for Motown Mondays with some homies two weeks ago and had a pretty solid time.  It was't very packed but that didn't bother me given it was Monday and we were there to just chill and listen to the music.  The bar is sick and extends like an "L" in the room with a dance floor on the far side and a booth behind that.  The group in the booth at the far end of the bar was probably the most hipster collection of people you could imagine, mustaches and all.  The beer they had on tap was unique and added a nice twist to what you normally find in SF.  It's cash only which is kind of annoying but so is everywhere else in the mission so not knocking them.  Bar tender was chill as well. It's a solid dive bar, no complaints from my experience.
author: Jamie B.

description:
Let me get a hell yeah! for the Bloody Mary here! I'm talking delicious with a garnish (AKA snack) of olives, pickled green beans, gehrkin, and a big ol slab of bacon laid cross-wise for your sipping pleasure. And on Sundays it's 5 big ones, or one Lincoln.

Great Mish spot. Think punk. Think scuzz. Think making out in the photobooth mid shooting billiards. Don't think yuppie. Don't think kids, unless your kid is cool and punk and can handle rad music played at 11.
author: Robbie B.

description:
Much like Thee Parkside, I'm definitely not cool enough to hang at Pop's on a regular basis. But with that being said, if I were sleeved with tats, got around town on the same skateboard I've been riding since the Tony Alva days, owned nothing but leather jackets, and only bought shoes at HUF, I'd be a regular here faster than you could say 'Dogtown and Z-Boys.'

There's no room for trust fund hipsters at this joint -- it's the real deal. These cats are the forefathers and mavens of the great American Apparel plot for world domination, and something tells me they'd happily ring the necks of any deep-V wearing art school dropout who tries to step on their turf with Serato boxes and bedazzled Toms slippers. Not shoes, slippers (c'mon, those things are ridiculous... even if they are a philanthroper's wet dream). Anyway, I think you get the point as to the general make up of their patrons....

As you might expect with a lead up like that, as for the space itself, you'll find dark sticky floors, cheap drinks, DJs spinning real vinyl in the back of the room, and bartenders who'd just as quickly give you the finger than entertain the idea of making you a lemon drop or apple tini, no matter which sorority sister is celebrating a birthday. 

If you're looking for the perfect night to play, hit 'em up on Monday when they'll throw down a plate of bacon with your tall Budweiser. I have a weakness when it comes to salty cured back fat, so the idea of coming here every single Monday isn't completely out of the question.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Man! I need to get to this side of the mission more often. bartender was super nice, great selection of beers, porn in the bathroom, photo booth and they let you bring burritos in!
author: Nicole O.

description: Chill spot... great for a quick drink. Most all goers are local so the vibe is chill. Pop in if your in the area.
author: Derick R.

description: While the iconic Pop's Bar is not the gritty dive that it used to be, it's still a solid neighborhood bar.  It's a great place to drink and watch a game.  Now that it's run by the people who do Madrone it has more DJs and live music.  It's still cash only and still has cans of Hamm's, though they are more expensive than they used to be.  The staff is nice, the selection of alcohol is reasonable, and the crowd is eclectic.
author: John H.

description: Best bloody mary on a Sunday.  Staggered over here after leaving the Blind Cat and damn those bacon bloodies are good!! Like the dark interior, wraparound bar oh and yeah the bloodies...
author: Sin F.

description: This review is based on me stopping in one afternoon to catch the end of a Giants game while on a Sunday walk past the joint.  Of course it is one of the few times I only have a couple bucks cash on me (cash only!) so had to use the in-house ATM and between that and my own bank's withdrawal fees, I'm sure I spent as much on fees than on my beer.  But not matter.  I enjoyed the half dozen mellow clientele and the general look and feel of the place.  I'd like to think I could make Pop's a regular every-other-Saturday-night place of mine but I don't think I would really last too long  None the less, I enjoyed and hope to visit again soon.
author: e w.

description: Chill bar with a small dance floor. Pleasant staff.
author: Inigo M.

description:
IDK, I like dives and I used to have a thing for hipsters, so this place was kind of a thing for me. Taken a few people here, but they were probably hipsters, so take it for what you will. Priced to sell. 

They have a great juke box, some awesome old school video games (pin ball and a table top Ms. Pac Man).

They don't do it anymore, but they used to have bad ass raffles here during Happy Hour and that got me hooked. I won a sparkly gold piggy bank from China Town and a Virgin Mary nightlight, which I still use (and works) to this day. Pretty sure this was like 5 years ago. 

Don't come here if you want a mojito. Don't come here if your name is Craig. Don't come here if you watch Jersey Shore. Just sayin'.
author: Bianca U.

description: Good drinks at great prices.  The menu is constantly changing, but that just makes it more interesting.
author: Michael G.

description: Decided to visit a bunch of places we have never been before while in the city for our anniversary. Great bar, good atmosphere, lovely ladies room. Fair drink prices, perfect neighborhood bar.
author: Amanda W.

description:
I haven't written a review about this place!

It's cheap and dive-y, and pretty much everything you want out of a bar. The bartender was cute and friendly, and it seems like a fun place to bring a group.

Pro note: Don't smoke outside, homeless pester for cigarettes more than anywhere I've been in San Francisco.
author: Clinton J.

description:
Dive bar?  WHAT?!?!?!  

Only in the bay area would people call this place a "dive bar". Let me tell you about a dive bar people....

DIve bars are seedy dark holes where drunk old washed up men / women hide from the sun as they wash their faded dreams with cheap whiskey and beer. 

The floor has a crust on it that harbors life yet undiscovered by man and the bartender has a 1000 yard stare so hard all the mirrors had to be taken down.


Silly hipsters wouldn't know a dive if it gave them syphillis.

Yes the drinks are cheap and it isn't the beauty bar or Zietgiest.....but it's not a dive either.   Its just a bar, your average city corner bar.  If it were a dive they would't allow hipsters in because the regulars would eat them and listening to hispters rage about why a place doesn't have PBR would cause the bartender to rip heads.
author: Spanky M.

description: I got Mt Tam pale ale and I liked it. But not as much as Westfalia red ale.
author: Ange G.

description: It was a terrible experience for us at the bar. The bartender was very rude, and did not even attempt to provide good service at the first place. Our friend just came back from Mexico and brought us a little shot of tequila, and when he just simply showed it to us, the bartender took the shot immediately and refused to give it back to us even though we tried to explain it was only a gift, and we was actually buying drinks this whole time and giving good tips. However this female bartender with blonde hair refused to listen to any explanation and began cursing us with very inappropriate expression in front of the whole place. It should have been a good night hanging out with friends, but she totally ruined it. We will never go back here again, and if you still love this place, make sure you don't go there on Thursday because of this crazy bartender!
author: Tina S.

description: Two words: PHOTO BOOTH! This is a classic part of my many trips to San Francisco that I will never forget. The first stop I made after leaving SFO on my first trip was there. The juke has the greatest choices on it and I love the crowd there, especially the dogs! Best dive bar ever. Thank you Pop's!!!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Ok, drastic change has to be made unfortunately. Besides being very inconvenient to get to, they have the worst DJs I've ever seen. Well there might be an exaggeration, but it's pretty close. I went on a Saturday night (maybe not the best night to go there) and it was like bro bar for hipsters. 

The DJs were seriously 2 OC looking dudes seating behind their Macs. The playlist started with Modest Mouse and then went down hill from there with a mix of Jimmy Eat World, The Ataris, Blink 182, and such. Seriously? You're gonna play Jimmy Eat World after Modest Mouse? I'm no music snob but 90's pop punk are THE WORST bands and obviously you know nothing about 90's indie rock. Were you really dj-ing or just playing random shit from your Pandora? 

The only highlight from this bar was they make good drinks and for $6 I got my sweet tea vodka in 16oz glass. Solid bartender tho it's not enough to keep me coming back.
author: Perry S.

description: Awesome bloody mary's, but the place is what I would consider a dive bar (even if other reviewers disagree).  I'll come back if I'm in the area.
author: Grace C.

description:
New to the San Francisco area, my lil' brother and I wanted to hit up a couple of bars that were local to 24th st to pass the Friday night hours. 

Our first stop Pop's. There was very few people although it was already 10pm. The bar is small, dark, dingy and with the eerie feeling you have some one starting at you. I LOVE IT! We found a couple of empty seats on the booths as we started to order some drinks. 

Drinks were very cheap I had a shot of a mystery tequila and a red stripe, the total was 9 dollars.... (im starting to like SF a whole lot more than LA). However the bartender there whose name escapes me was a bit of snobby bitch...yeah I said it. 

The gentlemen beside me after hearing that was my birthday ensued a conversation about the city, his life and how much he hates both. (I needed to get out, fast). After this interesting beginning we moved to the next stop....
author: alvarez p.

description:
It's hard to describe Pop's in anything less than holistic terms since it's far greater than the sum of its parts. 

I could describe the beverage prices or the dog guests or the clientele or the movies they show but all of these traits are reductionist.

Many "interesting" nights have either started or ended at Pop's. It is a hub of consequence.
author: Alan F.

description: Why 4? Good local beers on top and the decor is awesome for a dive bar. It is nice but still maintaining a style and its unique identity. The best is the music because they are playing Ramones, Metallica, Danzing, Ozzy and other 90s or earlier Metal/Rock/Punk in the middle of the day instead of stupid club music. I enjoy clubs etc but every place has its time and music so live with it. This is the rock place that you don't want to visit if you want to show off your ridiculously overpriced Chineese ripped off gucci bag. But if you are looking for some drinks and chilaxition than this is the right place to come to and spend your day. Otherwise f-off and go somewhere else to pretend that you are better than anyone else you stupid looser insecure pieace of rat sh^t.
author: Yup I.

description: Shitty music. No where to sit. Machine steals all your quarters. If you're in this unfortunate part of the Mission, though, at least you can get some cheap drinks.
author: Michael P.

description: Pop's bar is a great venue for dancing and live music. Excellent sound system and room acoustics for amplified live instruments and for DJs over the house PA. Also, excellent beers on draft. Friendly bartenders. Will come back again on a Saturday night without a second thought.
author: Gary D.

description:
Yawwwnnn...what's there to say that hasn't already been said? Run of the mill dive bar in the Mi$$ion that's filled to the brim with hipsters. 

Pros: Cute light up outside sign. Neighborhood bar. Bacon Mondays. Long happy hour. photo booth. 

Cons: Too many dirty smelling hipsters.

Dare I say I'd rather go to Dirty Thieves...maayybe even Clooney's or Brunos...
author: Nicole K.

description:
The drinks are way cheap here, but it's the photo-booth that really intrigues me about this place. I love it. It's got great matte, grainy, black and white pictures. Trust me, it quickly sucks you in.

I find it's a good way to immortalize boozin' nights. I never ordered a drink here, so can't report much about the bartenders, but there's a nice laid back vibe here and I saw some dogs hanging out in the front, which is always a great sign about an establishment in my opinion.  If I lived in the Mission, I could easily see me visiting this place often. Hipster squared is an understatement, but in an endearing way.
author: Jessica T.

description: R.I.P.  Pop's                                                  as Hipster as I thought it was sometimes it was fun to go there play pool listen to my friends dj metal / punk and take pictures in the old school photo booth. considering the current influx of techies/douchebags moving into the neighborhood I'm probably not going to like the new bar that will open but I will miss this one. The future is not looking good for rock-n-roll in San Francisco these days (even thought we built it on it) but we still have benders and the knockout but there farther away.
author: Mike S.

description:
I really can't say enough great things about Pop's. Where else can you watch a skater boy tame the half pipe, leave your mark in the bathroom, immortalize yourself in the photo booth, and rock out to 3 Inches of Blood and Slayer... all why enjoying an ice cold Tecate?

Malia (the owner and sexiest bartender to grace the Mission)  makes the best concoctions, always lends a friendly ear, and never hesitates to treat a familiar face like family. 

Pop's is the kind of place you tell your grandkids about, reliving the glory days of having one too many, singing and dancing with good friends , flashing your boobies without shame, getting a piggy back ride home from your boyfriend, and ultimately puking in the bushes.

I owe some of the best times of my life to this bar. Shame on all of you who gave Pop's less than 5 stars. Obviously you just don't get it, and in the end, it's probably for the best that you don't. That just means more good times for me.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
I WANT YOUR BEARD BURN ALL OVER ME. 

Sunday game night pwns. Nintendo + Dice games FTW. Cheap beer & babez for dayz.
author: Kelly Kate W.

description:
I always drag my friend here when I visit her because they have Racer 5 on Tap and a heavy handed pour for their cocktails fo' cheap, y'all.
Sure, this might add to the craziness that happens outside of this place - but... that's just part of the vibe as I've mentioned before.

Plus, the bartender's are awesome.... they have an oldies night, pups around to pet and there's Free Bacon on Mondays.
author: Katy A.

description:
This place still fails to disappoint... 

Lovin the racer 5 on tap.
Lovin the happy hour (til 8).
Lovin the staff (so nice...and so willing to put up with our somewhat obnoxious behavior after work on a Friday)
Lovin the prices ($3.50 a pint).
author: Monica C.

description:
Pop's has an plenty of space inside, an interesting layout, a pool table, friendly bartenders, and cheap drinks. (Oh, and a photo booth if that's your bag.) This is the kind of place that I'd probably keep to myself if I lived nearby.

But I don't live nearby, and my neighborhood doesn't have anything like this place. So here I am, telling you all about Pop's. Out of spite, mostly.
author: matthew r.

description: Wow, for working in a shitty bar that smells like rotting septic juice this chick bartender had a huge chip on her shoulder. I didn't tip not because I'm a poor Mission kid, but because the service was as shitty as it smells inside. And the PA is total garbage.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
Cool little dive bar with cheap beer and for the most part a pretty chill and friendly crowd.

We shot a few games of pool here, and I have to give them credit for having a really nice pool table.  Can't blame the table for being off if you biff a shot here.  They also have a South Park pinball machine, which even though I didn't play looked awesome.

The bartenders were a little slow, but it was the Fourth of July, so maybe they were drinking too and should be cut a little slack. 

However they did clear everyone out around 8:00 which was kind of weak, but did afford me the opportunity to see something funny.  While I was waiting for my friends to finish their beers I was outside having a smoke and witnessed a mass exodus of folks on fixed-gear bicycles.  I guess I hadn't realized how many hipsters were here until I saw that.  Pretty amusing.
author: Brad R.

description:
This might be the cheapest bar in the City.  They always have good specials and if nothing else you always get the PBR pitcher for $6 which holds about 4 pints.

My friends loved the free bacon on Mondays and its now become a legend among us.  Told with pride to disbelievers who don't understand the concept of free delicious bacon.

My boss now makes fun of me by calling me the beer and bacon guy but I see it as a badge of honor.
author: Jason S.

description: RIP POPS. I will miss your awesome drink specials and general dive-iness.
author: Darien W.

description:
The unassuming older man who tried to sell us morphine was by far the most gentlemanly person here.

A great selection of beers for a dive bar; also a great selection of loudmouthed deadbeats.  Pick your poison.  Some friends who recently moved to this neighborhood, former East Bay residents, seemed happy to be within walking distance of various attractions, but I'm hoping they don't count this place.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Last night I went to yoga with a friend of mine after which, we decided to hit up pops for a drink.  That turned into five Budweiser tall boys ($2 ALL NIGHT), and a grill cheese sandwich with fries from the diner across the street. 

You think that's bad? What's more, I unsuccessfully attempted to make a booty call when all I ended up doing was passing out with my pooch. I know what you're saying, "It's never a good idea to make a booty call after drinks at Pops," or  maybe like a good friend of mine says" Just know when to use it and know when to pass out gracefully".

Either way, I really like keeping the stool warm at this place.  Every third Tuesday of the month is Emo Karakeo Night--well worth it!
author: Mennlay A.

description:
this place is disgusting but i think that's the point.

i think a bunch of people would agree with me when i say that this is the quintessential hipster dive bar in the mission.  you'll often see a bunch of tight-jean wearing bike boys smoking cigarettes out front.  i think they take shifts.

i've done some sunday day-drinking here.
some late-night saturday drinking.
a few after-dinner drinks.

and Pops never gets less disgusting.  but that's okay.  there's a photobooth and a pool table.  the bathrooms are BEYOND horrendous so save your pee until you get home (your own or someone else's, wink wink).

oh, they have purse hooks under the bar so that's a major plus.
author: Lauren P.

description:
* now it's $6-6.50 pitchers of PBR, depending on your schmoozability.  Unfortunately I fall into the $6.50 range.

Also, the tap beers can be a little gnarly since they never ever clean their taps.  I like the $2 tecates all night baby.
author: Mari C.

description:
Now I know why people call this place Poops. 

I came in again and the place smelled like sharts and BO. The doorman overheard me saying that it smelled like the toilet overflowed, his reply was "it probably did". The clientele is the most annoying breed of skater hipsters, like the place isn't good enough for regular hipsters anymore. 

I will say that the bartender was very nice and attentive, I figure he thought we looked like we'd tip.
author: Manny F.

description:
Coolest Vibe ever!
Loved this place. From the pool table to the Pacman table top and graffiti tagging all in the restroom. I thought it was awesome. 
The bartenders were really nice. The crowd was super cool.
Beer wasn't priced high and yup I would come back here and if and when I live in SF this would be my local bar kinda like CHEERS but way more grungy and darker. Best time ever here!
author: Alison B.

description:
This bar is in stumbling distance from my house, so it gets extra points for that. It can be a bit grungy and they can play the music way too loud (especially on Wed Metal Night), but it is unfailingly the place I find myself after dinner parties, or on  Friday night with friends. 

Drinks are super strong and cheap, a gin and tonic runs about $4. 

Trivia: It can be seen in a couple of scenes of The Pursuit of Happiness, and it was featured on the Food Network show "What Would Brian Boitano Make"
author: Meagan F.

description:
Strictly as an alcohol providing establishment this place is fairly good.  Cheapish drink, friendly and attentive bartenders, and a pool table.

That being said, the patrons are pretty awful.  It isn't that they're hipsters, but that they are the judgmental type.  Came here with my Filipino/Hawaiian buddy and we were getting stares all night, since we're not hipsters, and he isn't right.  I guess we just didn't blend in, although the people working there are pretty cool.  Also, their patrons proceed onto 24th each night to tag white vans, most likely owned by local and minority-owned small businesses.  

Moral is- great place to be a hipster and white.  You're not welcome if you're brown and non-hipster.
author: Johan E.

description:
I came solely for the bacon and photo booth. It's also kind of uncomfortably dark in there. The photo booth was semi busted and my friend and I only got 2.5 of our pictures since the others didn't print. 


ALSO THERE WAS NO BACON IN SIGHT.
author: Pearl R.

description:
I've been enticed by this place ever since I saw their name pop up on the now defunct myopenbar list. How did they make it on there? Free bacon on Mondays...duh. Nothing like tasty slabs of salted pig to turn me into an alkie on a Monday.

I saunter into this place, and I kind of immediately feel like its very Samuel L. Jackson-esque from Pulp Fiction. I mean, everything about it....the super dim red lights, American Psyco on the TV, a crowd that is open to being cool, but only after they get to know you.

The bartender comes over after a short wait, and asks me what I want to drink. I really wanted to say "I'll have that bad ass mother fucker over there", but instead said "PBR". Trust me, I would have said the former if I would have pregamed a bit though. Over the course of the night, I guzzle 3 PBRs but only dent my wallet by $6...whoa. On top of all this? I got some free bacon on request.

Bartenders are pretty cool to talk to. One had clearly been born and raised inside a keg. Not only did he stand on top of a keg and roll it into place using only his feet, but he could also whip out a bottle opener with a 360 twist to it. That probably would look even cooler if it was done with a scary Dirty Harry gun.

Go on a Monday, you'll get a seat, you won't pay much for drinks, you'll eat free bacon, and you'll be a bad ass motherfucker.
author: Sean C.

description:
This place can get pretty smelly on busy nights. I'm not saying its the crowd of unbathed hipsters or the weathered old building. But it could be. They have daily specials that I do like to take advantage of. My favorite being $1 pints of PBR on Saturadays. After 4 i think. 

The staff can be pretty obnoxious carnival folk, but you know I guess thats part of the whole shtick. On one visit I had been ordering drinks but not leaving a tip. I usually do this at the end if I plan on being planted at the bar. Just seems kind of cheesy to drop money evertime they bring you a drink if youre not moving. Do you give your waitress a buck every time she refills your coke? Didnt think so. So this bartender, as im getting ready to leave, gathering my things and actually REACHING FOR MY WALLET says "Thanks for the tip" Ughh Who the hell does that. Im really generous when it comes to tipping, but I stopped reaching for my wallet that day. FTS!
author: Alfredo R.

description:
I unabashedly love Pops and was a regular there for years.  Not so much anymore, but not because I love it any less. 

It's the ur-SF dive bar in my mind.
author: Brigid B.

description: My first few visits to Pop's were marred by the presence of tools, hipsters, and dimwits. Since then, however, they've mostly cleared out and now I am a 100% booster of this place. Sure, it's always possible that any given hour may see your precious shared airspace invaded by schmucks who annoy you -- that's just America, i guess. Viva Pop's!
author: John G.

description:
Why you come to Pop's?

- you want to have fun, drink beer and talk smack with friends
- $2 tall cans of Bud sounds like a Godsend when you only have $10 in your pocket. 
- you don't feel like dressing up
- you like loud obnoxious drunk people who will randomly bust moves to Michael Jackson
- you love watching throw back films like E.T. 
- you're broke, you want to drink, you're not high maintainence, and you're down to earth. 

Pop's isn't fancy but it's a grungy ass bar bar, though you already knew that when you walked in. 

Watch out for those narly ass bathrooms.
author: Dorothea G.

description:
What Pop's has taught me:

Wearing your baseball hat backwards causes brain damage.
Carrying a board with wheels on it means you are on drugs.
Not shaving makes you smell like raw sewage.
author: Dinner Dog X.

description:
I met a "secret friend" at Pop's the other night for drinks & conversation.

Though Pop's is, literally, two blocks from my apartment I'd never been there... I don't know why, as my roommate (Bonnie) told me that they serve free bacon there on Monday nights.  You'd think that would be impetus enough for me to go there immediately...

For some reason it wasn't.  Maybe I'm losing my edge.

Anyhow - this is where I met my "secret friend" the other night (b/c it is close to home & it was raining.)

My "secret friend" & I were both pretty impressed with Pop's - it's a great dive-punky bar - one which was even crowded on a weeknight.  The drinks are very cheap, there's a pool table, a photo booth & the bar has it's regular creepy guys who listen in on your private conversations... Making lewd comments under their breath as if they were a part of it...  Plus, lots of punk rock Mish hipsters... PLUS, PLUS - two blocks from Taqueria El Farilito which stays open until midnight on weekdays, 2am on weekends and is the perfect place to get grub to soak up the cheap drinks you spent time consuming at Pop's.

Plus Free Bacon Monday.

What else does one need?  Five stars, baby.
author: Kate R.

description:
You had me at Free Bacon.

With this bar being two blocks from my house, I frequent it pretty often. The fact that everything here is pretty dirt fucking cheap makes me come here even more! Not to mention the free bacon on Mondays.

Things to avoid here: Mission brofest guys. They can be so annoying and sometimes the crowd in itself gets kinda...off. But for the most part this bar is pretty awesome.
author: Trav M.

description:
I heard a rumor that "Pop's is the new 540" for those of us former-Inner-Richmonders-turned-Missionaries. 

I don't know.

I just don't know.

The color scheme -- maybe. But this place is way too hip and sedate to be compared to the 540. They do, however, get bonus points for a pool table. And a photo booth. And an ATM! With a Thrasher sticker on it. Which seemed to my drunken self to be PRETTY DAMN COOL since my bf works for Thrasher (even though it's really totally of no consequence to the bar or this review) and kept me entertained while I withdrew money I couldn't afford to throw away on more alcohol that I definitely didn't need.

But -- not the 540. Where are the awesome, generous, ebullient bartenders? The loud, jovial, friendly, no-scene regulars?

Okay -- I answered my own question. I live in the MISSION now.
author: Lisa T.

description:
This bar could not suck any harder if it were a back-alley crackwhore down on her knees looking to score some rock. 

I so wanted to like this place, being as I live five steps away from it and it had the potential to be my local. Any bar where, upon last call, I'm a mere 30 seconds away from my mattress, has to fuck it up pretty hard not to get my vote. 

Much has been said here about the tediousness, the prententiousness, and the scab-addleness of Mission hipsters, so I won't elaborate too much on the tedious, pretentious, scabby clientele. I will say that these people, on any average night, act as though this is their first time in a bar. Ever. There is screaming, yelling, hair-pulling, hand-wringing, and puking on a regular basis. Learn to hold your drink, peoples. You're an embarassment to Mission hipsters everywhere.

And the first night I moved in? We enthusiastically popped over to Pops, looking to settle in and introduce ourselves to the bartenders as neighbors and make some friends. What we saw was the bartender doing a healthy coke trade from behind the bar and four sketchy-ass motherfuckers looking to pick a fight with anyone who looked at them crossways. We were later awakened by those same four gentlemen kicking the shit out of a homeless man in the middle of the street at 2:15, one of whom was pissed because he'd gotten the homeless guy's blood on him.

Goddamn, seriously? I wanted to like this place--the drinks are cheap, the vibe has potential, and the photo booth kicks ass. But's it the few dozen that spoil it for the rest of us, huh? Give this one a miss and head down to Dirty Thieves (formerly Treat Street) or Jay and Bee.
author: kdub ..

description:
Bad Pops! Bad!

You should be so great because you're the first placed I used my ID. You are across the street from the Brava, where I had my film school graduation. You have cheap, plentiful beer.

But it's the plentiful amount of douche bags that kills me. Look, I'm down with hipsters, but not these old guys who seem to want to be both hipster and punk (stick to one fellas - are you sensitive and arty or do you like breaking bones?).

Anyway, as I was talked down from fighting the entire bar last night, I realized. I'm not a huge fan.

Such a waste.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Now that I've gotten over the trauma of the incident below, I'm open to hitting up Pop's again. What can I say, that cute 'tender behind the bar serves it up right.

One star for the photo booth.
One star for the pool tables.
One star for erotic photo hunt.
One star for the juke box.
One star for 2 tequila shots and 2 Tecates = $8 total. 

Only one star and I will never go back because I saw someone get shot in front of the bar on Friday night. Dive bars aren't few and far between. You can find plenty of good ones all over this city. I'm not your typical Marina girl. I love to venture out into every different 'hood, but there's a reason that I live in the Marina and that's because I'm not trying to get shot while I'm drinking the work week away on a Friday night at Happy Hour. Sorry Pop's, but it's just not worth it.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Okay, you know you're a geek when someone mentions an establishment, and you must IMMEDIATELY go home and Yelp! it. Sort of like my dad, when he'd consult Consumer Reports before making a major purchase. 

So my friend Julie's in town from Tucson and says "let's meet at pop's at 9." Sadly, I must be out of it, because i'm like "Pop's? Huh??? Like the mom and pop store on Divis and McAllister?" Yeah, something like that. So I go home and Yelp it. Then I'm like, "Oh yeah, Pop's, hipster bar at 24th in the Mission, know it well." It begats the Cliff Claven in all of us. 

Pretty cool little bar. Yeah, it's loaded with hipsters, but I just spent a week in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, so I've hipster--proofed.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Stretch that to a 3.5.
I've only been here on off days (Tuesday nights, Sunday  nights), so it's always been fairly chill. 
Daily specials -- $2.50 jager shots to $2 tall boys? $1 PBR? I'm down to get down. 
$3 photobooth -- Uh, hello.
Pool tables, the most awesome movies on tv (Adams Family, The Bachelor Party, etc), and really random music. Chill ass crowd,
Only 2 blocks from my house so it's gotta be a staple.

Only issue I have is to please, PLEASE not let the bathroom flood again for whatever reason and not do anything about it. Kthx.
author: Chieh T.

description:
This is certainly my "neighorhood" dive....and that's true for several "regulars" I see there everytime I stop in.

It's cheap. Like, HELLA CHEAP. You can always get a pitcher of Pabst for $6.50 (except on Tuesdays, when it's only $5). The Happy Hour is awesome ($2 wells and $2 domestics). The daily specials are great (Wednesday is $1 Hammes, if you're into that thing). 

The jukebox is a thing of dreams. In one sitting, I played Minor Threat, the Misfits, and Operation Ivy. The next person up knocked out Iron Maiden and Madonna. After that, I think I heard Snoop Dogg. 

There is a photo booth ($3 for 4 pictures/black and white/on the darker side) that has captured many of my drunken nights.

A lot of people who have known about this bar for ages are jaded on it, claiming it's stuffed with hipsters and over-rated. Well, welcome to San Francisco. :)

I love you, Pop's....even if you're in a sketch part of town. May your bicycle-decorated walls and dirty pool table live on!
author: Danyell K.

description:
Pop's used to be one of my favorite hangouts in the city.  Fun to be had any night of the week.  On weekends by midnight it's usually packed to the brim with hipsters leaving art shows or broken up parties & whatnot.  Also, they dont usually I.D. so expect to run into a few underagers.  

The bar is pretty small a few tables & booths line the left wall, stools at the bar.  Pinball, jukebox, pool table & photo booth in the back.  I would recommend against playing pool here because the drunk patrons making their way to the bathroom as well as the close proximity of the jukebox & walls will just piss you off.

I also recommend against using the photo booth because the regulars (i.e; hipsters) will give you dirty looks and snicker, & don't play Lynard Skynard's 'Free Bird' before 1:30 a.m.  or you will get booed, but I guess that goes for any bar.
author: Mike S.

description:
I love Pops, LOVE Pops.
Heres why:
-Friendly bartenders
-Groovin' tunes that are reminiscent of wacky high-school hijinks 
-Very dark and good for making out
-Cheap drinks
-a pool table (ok so lots of places have pool tables but still)
but most impotantly...A PHOTO BOOTH!!!
Seriously I'd go to this place just for that.
I definitely don't get a hipster vibe at all. If anything it's almost anti hipster. Or maybe I'm just too drunk to notice.
PS It definitely has a bit of a "funk" to it, like a mens lockeroom or a frathouse (not that I've ever been to one but thats how I'd imagine it would smell).

Edited to add: Last night there was a Basset Hound there. Thats right a BASSET HOUND!!! Could anything have made it better? I don't think so.
author: Catty C.

description:
Pop's is not on my list of the  bars that I frequent, but on the list of bars I just "end up going to"

pros:
1. photo booth 
2. nice bartenders that replace drinks that dumb f-ers happen to think is their own
3. blended margaritas
4. nice when it's empty (rarity)

cons:
1. over the amt. of 10 people it's a fire hazard
2. skanky bitches everywhere
3. and well it's kinda off the beaten path for my stumble/ride walk bike home thing.
4. I almost always get into some confrontation waiting (yes waiting always) to use the bathroom
author: A. Gun n.

description: RUN dont walk to Pop's if Eva von Slut is DJing..... every song you wanna hear, she has it! She turns a typical weekend evening into a NYE party!!!! 5 stars to Pop's and Miss von Slut!
author: Alyson O.

description:
If you live in the hood its a great place to "catch a twist" while you do laundry. 

Happy hours 4 - 8 pm everyday

Different drink specials every night

Pool table. 

Never seen a hot girl in there that I wasn't with.
author: Joe G.

description:
I spent at least 80% of the nights here for the last three years of my life. It's not for everyone but it's definitely for me.

Dark, dimly lit environment, providing a juke box, a pool table, video poker, erotic photo hunt and table-top video games. The bartenders are all welcoming and friendly and the drinks are always on the cheap. Pay attention to the specials: Sun - $2.50 Jager, Mon - $1.50 Bud bottles, Tues - $5 pitchers of PBR, Wed - $1 Hamm's (my personal favorite), Thurs - $2 Bud tall cans, Fri - $2 well drinks, Sat - $1 PBR

The perks? Monday night, Tuffy gives out free bacon, Wednesdays have Handlebars at the DJ table, Thursdays in the summer time there are BBQs and cookouts and once a year they have Tricycle races.

The crowd on the average night is usually a close-knit, loud-mouth group of regulars and a few randoms who wandered into the bar. The busier nights, which tend to be Wednesdays and weekends can get a rather eclectic clientele in there that has you wondering, "Where did these people come from?" But if you are a fan of flannel, have tattoos and know how to talk shit, you'll probably fit right in here.

Its a comfortable place, too far out to be picked up on the radar of the super hip, so it tends to be completely lacking of airs. It's somehow become my gold standard of bars. I don't know how it happened but I find myself in other bars thinking, "*sigh* It's not Pop's." And now that I'm away from the city, I miss it. I actually miss a bar. 

By the way, here's a little bet for you: There's a 98% chance that any night you visit, you will hear "Ace of Spades" and "Crazytrain" each at least once, if not several times.
author: Torey B.

description: This place--work at SFGH as an MD, was teh worst shift in the ER since the plane crash,w ent with three other doctors all over 30, had hospital ID and license photo, embroidered scrubs, the otehr 32 year old and 40 year old, and we were kicked out of this bar on a Monday night at 12:30 for leaving our IDs in the hospital. Never coming here again even if it is the closest bar after a long shift. Jerks.
author: Adbn A.

description:
Get over your anti-hipster rage (you know that attitude just makes you more of a hipster yourself, right?) and give this bar a chance. If you're into super nice AND super attentive bartenders with exquisite drink makin' skills, then you're in luck.  If you like photo booths that give you black and white strips (which makes everyone look prettier and handsome-er, with or without beer goggles on), then you're even luckier. Pool, pinball, a table top video game, and, of course, erotic photo hunt all ensure your visit to be both drunken and productive. . .well, if you're like me and consider playing games to signify productivity. 

Jessi's beer raffle is every Tuesday from 4-9pm, and she gives away super prizes that only YOUR eyes will BELIEVE in PERSON! And you win them just for drinking! I'm totally not lying! Amazing! Every day's a gift!

This is a fantastic happy hour bar, but I enjoy Wednesday nights for the $1 Hamms special. The weekends get a little rowdy and very crowded, but hey, live a little. 

And if all the hipsters still continue to weird you out, just think: at least YOU can legally drink alcohol! And we all deserve pats on the back for that one.
-------------------------
9/07/06 ADDENDUM:
Jessi and Halsey now provide free bbq (for carnivores, opportunivores, and vegetarians alike), rotating DJs, and $4 pint glass-sized Mojitos or Margaritas (as well as the standard $2.50 draft beers and $2.00 well drinks fare) from 4pm-9pm on Thursdays. Have I mentioned what fabulous bartenders these ladies are? Well, they're drink-making geniuses. And total babes.

BEST DAY EVER!
author: Chloe S.

description:
A dive bar through and through.  Over the past years the clientele has drastically change.  This bar is now the epicenter of the hipster movement.  If that's your cup of tea you will be in heaven.  If you are not a hardcore hipster steer clear of this place on the weekend.

Despite the gang violence around this location last summer this is a safe bar.  As a  woman I never in felt unsafe in the bar or hanging around outside by myself.
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description:
I am diggin on Pop's simply because it is right around the corner from my new pad.They serve a great selection of beer and have the best ATM sign I've ever seen. Oh, and a photobooth. It is black and white, and those are the best kind because the high contrast makes everyone look beautiful. I can pass those pictures out to all my future boyfriends and they will think I was a model in a past life, but really I was just drunk at Pop's.

*EDIT* I've decided to remove one star from this review because after getting to know the bar a wee bit more, I have some complaints. Too many vagrant/hipsters all f*cked up on pills. The last couple of appearances I've made, the patrons have been a wee bit too good for their gutter punk clothes and so rowdy and annoying that holding a conversation without having a drunk scream in your ear or run into you, spilling your beer all over the bar, is close to impossible. I do like the bartenders, but could really do without most of it's visitors.
author: Zara E.

description:
Pop's is what you make it.  Just like any other bar. 
The bar tenders are awesome and drinks are strong and cheap, and juke box has good music... what more can you ask for in a dive bar.
God you guys are ruff.
Yeah it's in a not so nice part of the mission, but don't take it out on Pop's.
I used to live 5 doors down from here and I've many a times here.  
Plus you can get free bacon on mondays and dollar beer on wed.  
Who doesn't love specials!
author: amanda v.

description:
The music is too loud, the clientele thinks they're tougher than they are (or perhaps they think they're appropriately tough and are just tougher than I think they are?), there isn't enough light, and it's mostly dudes, but...

$1 Hamm's on Tuesday, $1 High Life on Wednesday.

So while I can say it's not my exact cup of tea, the perks often outweigh the negatives and I occasionally pay it a visit. If I lived closer, I could see this place growing on me. It's got the kind of grimy/cutesy charm usually only found in stray dogs and orphans.
author: Daley T.

description: Good neighborhood bar , everything you'd expect from the hip mission district dive bar ! Thumbs up and bottoms up , get smashed!
author: Gabriel O.

description:
Wednesdays - $1 Hamm's.

I don't particularly like Hamm's but I do specifically love getting tossed on a $5-spot.
author: C P.

description:
Ah...I love it when a pint of PBR and a Bud Tall Boy are the same price--$2 baby.  But, I'm classier than that, so I always start with vodka...then I'll move to crappy, hipster beer.  

Perfect dive bar atmosphere but super-friendly staff, which is such a bonus when you go to dive bars because usually you have some idiot in his/her early 20s, with more tattoos than brains, in dirty clothes, and thinks that being rude=cool behind the bar more often than not.  

Thankfully that is not the case with the girls working the bar at Pops.  Super-friendly, funny, and bless-em, they all have lead wrists.  

Though, I will have to grumble a little over the crowd.  The people around my age in the crowd were cool, but then you have a small minority of baby, wannabe-hipster chicks ruining your buzz.  It's idiots like this that always bump into you at the bar (even though the tall, CCR-plaid-shirt wearing dudes managed to order without doing it and they are twice the size of these girls), spill shit on you, pass out drunk in the bathroom, etc.  

Maybe I'm too old (NEVER!!!) for this shit.
author: MakeUp M.

description: Maybe it's the cheep drinks, but somehow I always have the best nights at Pop's.
author: Peter v.

description:
I came here on a night where there weren't more than fifteen people there (losers; it's a fucking Friday night), and there were dogs.  The bartender poured drinks so strong I spluttered. 

I am not as shitty at pool as I thought (although still pretty shitty), and I will give this place four stars because there is a photo booth.  This is important. 

I can imagine how much of a trial this place would be if it were crowded; indeed, I got accosted by every dude over 30 in the place, plus that one hideously drunk kid in the Campagnolo hat who kept yelling instead of talking, the dear.
author: Laura Y.

description: This place smells like ass and donuts.  leave your tag on the photobooth and down that Hamms.  POPS IS THE PLACE.
author: Troy S.

description:
I hate Pop's.  You know why?  Because I'm too old to be dating those stinky hipsters, no matter how many bad things  I wanna do to them.  Besides, I may be stinky, but I'm not a hipster and don't ride a fixed gear bike, so there's no way they'd wanna bang me anyway.  And that pisses me off.  Why couldn't I have been a hipster?  I'm stinky!  I'm dumb!  I too can wake up at 2 in the afternoon and head straight to the bar!  I HAVE done this!  What does it take to interest you people?

Jesus.  Maybe if I got some scabs on my legs and cold sore, then they'd wanna hit it.  Well, either hipsters or the homeless in my neighborhood would.  I guess I have to see if I'm willing to go the extra mile to get laid.
author: Coco D.

description: If you're looking for reasonably-priced booze and a fun crowd, Pop's is solid.  Plus, there's tons of great food all over the Mission, so it's pretty much got everything - AND they're dog-friendly.  Go to Pop's if you're looking to get crunk (i.e. not wearing your nice shoes).
author: Byung Ho B.

description:
Two dollar pints?
Two dollar pints!
TWO DOLLAR PINTS!!!

This bar has everything a dive should.
Great jukebox, fast and lowkey bartenders, cheap drinks and good company. So simple and so fun.

And for some reason it smells like French toast in back? Hm... love it.
author: Megan B.

description:
I walked past some chick shooting up on the street and then noticed a few cops walking towards her to help her out or at least inspect what was going on.

Inside, Pop's is a weirdly shaped interior but nicely far away from the super busy areas of the Mission.  Not much attitude when I went although it was on the early side.  Unfortunately didn't get to use the photo booth since i was running late and only had time to enjoy my one drink - such a lush!
author: Gene X.

description:
Most bars that cater to the kind of people who dominate in Pop's are only ersatz dive at best. I like Pop's because it has managed to stay filled with default-gentrifiers and yet keep it's welfare- friendly ambiance. 

i went in there once with a co-worker who was really freaked out about all the white people, and when we made it clear that we were there to get hammered cuz work that day had sucked for her, the bartender gave us free doubles! 

The booze is relatively cheap, the drinks are strong, they have punk-rock on the box... No matter how much the rents go up in the Mission cuz pierced anglo hipsters keep showing  the middle class white folk it's safe to live here, i will always have a soft spot in my heart for Pop's!
author: XTA s.

description:
One time I came here and it smelled like a locker room mixed with throw up, except I was the only one who didn't notice.  I think it was because I was acclimated to the smell of the black hoodie that I always wear when I go out to a cool bars like this.  

Anyway, normally I would give just 2 stars, but I hear they give out bacon on Mondays, so they've earned another star in my book.
author: Kim S.

description:
Pops is kind of okay.

They have a photo booth. 

They have a pool table.

They have cheap Pabst beer on tap. 

The owner is punk-rock glamorous in her own way and she has a dog that is sometimes in the bar.

So, it has the essentials for any greasy haired punk rocker mission hipster. 

Sadly, the crowd is FULL of straight hipsters, and emo-aggressive straight guys who want to rule the pool table.  Which is why I haven't been in a long time.

They should have a queer night. That would make it more fun.

I still occasionally pop in (no pun intended), to take a few photo booth snap shots.
author: Grant D.

description:
The only time it's ever acceptable to purchase Hamm's is when it's significantly less expensive than any other option on the table (or the bar, as the case may be).

Pop's not only legitimizes Hamm's purchase and consumption, but makes anything else seem crazy... They'll even poke a hole in the top of the can for you so you can pound 'em frat-boy style... how's that for service with a sneer?

It's sad that I'm not hipper than I am (or at least living in the neighborhood) so I could justify spending more time here.
author: Nick S.

description: OMG.  Jesse the bartender is a total fucking babe.
author: Katie Sue A.

description:
Come here if you want stiff Sapphire Tonics for cheap. 

But you do not want to use their bathroom.
author: Katy W.

description:
I've only been to Pop's once for a birthday party... but it was nice. Nice and crowded, and although I had to shout to talk to friends, the drinks were good, the bartenders were friendly, and I never had to wait very long to order some booze. Oh! And the champagne in a can!! That gets the 4 stars.
Yes, get loaded and show some boob in the photo booth, it's what all the chicks did.

And yes, I was there only once, but I saw a ton of chicks, it's too bad, I was the only fat one though.
author: Jenn H.

description:
I think I would dig this bar a bit more if it didn't cost me 20 bucks to get to and back.  Definitely cool for a neighborhood dive.  I love the photo booth and the graffiti in the bathroom is engrossing and creative.  Also, they have Sofia champagne in a can (stoked!) ...because when I'm in a hipster Mission dive, I always drink champagne.  

ps...the sweet window video game table looks like it would be perfect on a sunny Sunday afternoon.  Just don't try to fit too many pals around it.
author: Beth G.

description:
My old neighborhood bar.

Its around the street from the house, so I used to just go there to pee.

Drink at Pops!
author: Sam P.

description: Do you like tattooed men wearing t-shirts that haven't fit them since 5th grade who spend more time on their hair than the average woman, only to make it look like they spent no time on it at all? Do you like spending your evenings in small, loud, dirty, crowded bars that require a ridiculous amount of effort to get to if you live anywhere but the Mission? Is PBR your beer of choice? If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this is the bar for you.
author: Alfredo A.

description:
Everything I look for in a bar: cheap, dark, Marina-folk-free.

Love the bartenders! 

I've never noticed any hipsters... all the people I recognize are actual bike messengers. not hipsters.
author: Towanda S.

description: Dirt cheap, smelly, dark... Pops has everything I appreciate in a bar. The crowds never get too crazy which is also a huge plus.  Pops is my go to bar and will continue to be in the future. Had to give 4 stars since they don't have PBR on tap anymore. What gives? The Tecate costs more, keep Pops cheap.
author: Sam C.

description:
A while back I got flagged down by a pal o mine who likes to hang out with the skater crowd, he was smokin out side o Pop's bar... cool sign i thought. We went inside, it was a mellow evening, the beer was cheap and the bartenders friendly. Some how we wound up comemorating the evening in a rush of Inland Empire brotherly bonding in the photo booth. Nothing perverse, just two men who share a love for our common home town. 

In the passing years my sweet baby found the place on her own and fell in love with it on her own terms so now I'm doubly compelled to return.

i don't make it there often but every time I do, I have a great time... in spite of the "I'm going to pick the most ironically jacked up song on the juke box" competition that seems to occur nightly.
author: Mike Z.

description:
ahhh.... so hot!!  Loves dis bar.  I'm such a regular, but seriously, this bar ROCKS!!!

Loves my girlzz M and H!!!

xoxoxox
author: Pammy S.

description: I felt as if I had stepped into a Hold Steady song when I walked in.  Aerosmith was on the jukebox; girls with dangerous curves in tight black pants curved over the bar, displaying their ample cleavage with an attempt to have the bartender purchase them a free drink.  Inevitably somebody would end up passed out in a gutter.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Fun little strange bar. 
Friendly bartenders & a decent beer selection.

Not to be missed:
The ATM sign above the bar with the metal typeface and bonus lightning bolt arrow.
author: kristin n.

description: POPS is like a construction site, when I'm there im clocked in and doing work. Getting hammered, and using power tools.
author: Ryan P.

description:
POPS IZ DA SHIZ! All my homies come out and play at Pops.
I used to go here when it was a front for the drug-dealing Mission gangsters.

New owners turned it around, and now it's full of underaged girls that get drunk and wanna get laid! (hopefully by me!)

Good drinks, good vibes, and good fun.
author: Danny S.

description:
I dont go to pops as much as I'd like to. but i always see good friends there, and the barkeeps are awesome.

photobooth is off the hook

Heres a tip:  if you "bump" into the jukebox, it skips the song!
author: Joey R.

description:
I came here for the first time on my 21st birthday (which just happened to be heavy metal night). 

Everyone at the bar stared at my friends and I. Perverted old men mouthed things to me.

All in all, it was a creepy experience. Not sure when I'll be back to feel like everyone was undressing me with their eyes.

I did like the photobooth.
author: j o.

description:
I like pops because it is very... very very close to my home. Its a definite testosterone bar.. lots of men. and I have heard a couple horror stories relating to that, namely that a lot of the guys are massive assholes sometimes. I havent witnessed anything bad in that sense,
HOWEVER one time I saw a man finger a lady's butt here... and that was extremely traumatic, that's what lost Pops some stars.
But I like a dollar beer as much as anyone else does, so I like to show up on weds nights.
Lately my trips to Pops are pretty much limited to wednesday nights and maybe a beer or drink before heading out somewhere else since it is right next to me.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Whenever I come here, the rest of my night always get strange. I mean this in the best way possible.
Yes, the place is crowded with hipsters and most people here want to do some drugs. 
So what? You came to a dive bar in the Mission, what else were you expecting?
author: Sarah M.

description:
I would like to give this 3.5 stars.  I guess that isn't possible.

The crowd is nice looking.  There is good music. The drinks are not cheap and the are not expensive.  This is a very average mission bar with some above average patrons.

I've been yelping all day, save me from myself.

P.S. The photo booth is where you go to make out... like you are 14. Awesome.
author: Thadd L.

description:
I like Pop's Bar! This would be my kinda place if I lived in the City. THe people here were my type of peeps. Keep to themselves unless you are saying something worth a shit. Love it. No too cool for school vibe at all.

The photo booth was great here! Black and white and a good time!
author: Letty D.

description:
I love Pop's, and yeah, it's your average Mission dive bar... with a multi-game arcade tabletop machine (save me from my newly rediscovered Dig Dug addiction), make-out photobooth, and friendly bartenders who have no qualms about kicking out obnoxious assholes. Pop's is in a really great, adorable part of the Mission, my favorite area (yes, I'm a resident).

It's across from St. Francis Fountain, where you can get yummy hotcakes (bacon, cheddar, and onion, mmm) to absorb some of your alcohol... or not.
author: Jacqui M.

description:
Any bar that displays a photobooth photo of a dude getting a blow-job, deserves a visit.  Old-timey black/white photobooth alone makes it.

I like this bar when it isn't so crowded.  But that goes for any bar, anywhere. 

The bartenders are all friendly and pour nice drinks.  The happy hour specials are good and they have my favorite local beer on tap (Downtown Brown).

I don't always love the crowd though. I realize again, that I'm totally stereotyping when I write this, but that's the beauty of an opinion.  The scene is some cross between scary dirty bike messenger / punk rocker / rock-a-billy mission hipster.  Maybe I'm so out of touch I can't figure out what the scene is, but whatever it is, folks aren't very friendly to those of us who don't dress like them.

I forgot to mention - table top pac man, pinball, pool table.
author: cindy p.

description: If you've brushed your hair today, you're too dressed up for Pop's. Despite the fact that this is where THINK sweatshirts come to die, pints are generally $4, and there's a decent jukebox. Just don't sit at the bar, it's full of weirdos.
author: Carla C.

description: Pop's is the closest bar to my work (except Jack's Club) so it has become the default post-shift watering hole.  It also serves as a magnet for drunk, disheveled hipsters, like the Noc Noc of the Mission.  The kicker is a $6.50 pitcher of PBR.  And the photo booth.  And the 22 year-old Pat Benetar in the corner falling onto a pile of empty kegs and shattering her glass of rum and coke.  Oh wait, that really happened....  You get what you pay for.
author: Eric S.

description: straight forward and no frills dive.  their pours are heavy handed, and the prices are a steal to boot!
author: Sheri N.

description: Great neighborhood dive nothing special just keep the drinks coming!! Locals are friendly so come through and have a drink
author: MIGUEL G.

description:
Last night me and some rando at a party got talking about the band Knapsack. The conversation led to the one time I went to Pop's for their mid 90s emo night. My review of this place is really only based on that one night, but nonetheless, I don't really feel guilty painting a broad brush. If you've been to one Mission dive bar full of nu-hipsters, you've been to them all. 


I was excited to go for mid nineties emo night bc I've always had a soft spot for this era that I should probably be ashamed of, but am not. So I roll up in there with a couple of people who I didn't really know, but equally had the same embarrassing love for this genre. First thing that happened was a song I really liked was played. Then, a couple real poser tracks showed up. Shit like newer Hot Water Music and AFI.
