I looked around and noticed that Pops' particular brand of Mission clientele was that of the skateboarder hipster type. Lots of tight jeans, beanies, and two sizes two big flannels. Also, not many girls. This kind of put in context why the songs I didn't want to hear were being played. I imagine those songs are on a lot of skate videos and the DJs must play to the crowd every once in awhile. 

So anyway, hanging out most the night was fine. Nothing spectacular happened other than a few to-be-expected snubs from people with poor social skills and of minimal accomplishment. I tried to shoot the shit with a couple people while trying to get drinks and was given the "who the fuck are you" look. The older I get, I still don't get this. I mean, if you don't want to hang out and be social, go drink at home. Not to mention, you're not gonna get laid if you're not willing to talk to people But again, I'm old enough to know that these places tend to always be like that, so I can only blame myself I guess.

In summary. Emo night was nothing to rave about. Drinks were cheap. Bar tenders weren't anything of note (good or bad). Basically, it offers nothing to compensate for the fact that it's too far a walk from BART and not close enough to other bars for me to go to when I inevitably get bored of this place.
author: Matt P.

description:
Mikey says it's a good bar. Wednesday nights are usually the only time I go. I don't go anymore because I'm over it, but yeah, Wednesday nights all my friends show up for 1 dollar hamm's. Pretty good deal for a budget hump day night. Plenty of people frequent there. Lots of local celebs, including a handful of pro skaters and messengers who ride track bikes. A bunch of hipster shit goes down. There is a 10:3 man:woman kinda thing going down as well. The dude mansion always shows up by-the-way, and Mancini, the door dude, does tattoos and that's cool. Yeah, this place got old fast for me. My friends are always there. It's always a fun time, and it beats the delirium that's for sure. 

Stephie thinks it might secretly be a place for the hipster version of the "downlow" community.
author: Steph and Mike A.

description: I'm glad I discovered Pop's. It's a cute little dive bar with odd but neat style. We got a pbr on draft for only $2, pretty good since I was expecting to receive a can. The crowd was rockin' and rowdy, which is fun when you're in the mood to drink cheap beer. I appreciated the fact that they were playing loud punk rock, because it's rare these days for me to randomly come across a bar that plays these types of tunes. I was also diggin the friendly locals, tricycles hanging on the walls, and diner-ish style bar theme.
author: Sonya D.

description: General hipster hellhole, not in a good way.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
i went to the mission on a mission to ride a mechanical bull. sadly, i missed out on the fun - i showed up as the bull was being dismantled.  angry and frustrated at the situation, i grabbed me some crab flakes, a guy named max, and a chick who saves lives and we booked for the closest bar to drink the pain away.  pops it was.  

i like pops because they served me drinks at 1:30 where some other bars pull this 'last call' shit and refuse to give you more booze after like 1:15.  the difference between these times is of the utmost importance if you have wasted precious time chasing after a mechanical bull and need to get the most out of your saturday night drinking experience.  

i also like pops because it is one of the few places in this city that makes me feel like i'm back in philly.  in fact, the only other time i had ever been to pops i met people who knew my friends back in philly.  how much more could i ask for?

minus one star cuz the bathrooms are gross.
minus another for the freak who wanted to drag me into the photobooth.
author: Karen K.

description:
I just moved a few blocks away from here and I decided to check it out last night.  5 dollar pitcher? Why thank you.  Kind of reminds me of Trash Bar in Brooklyn, except with cheap drinks. 

Dirty rock and roll bars always woo me over.
author: Adam C.

description:
i have had it with the patrons of pops -  they snort cocaine under my window and I've witnessed them vandalize the building next door with spray paint. they show a complete lack of respect for the citizens of our community. they prefer to pee outside as i have witnessed numerous clientele on multiple occasions peeing behind our vehicles, all over the street, mailbox, and sidewalk. they stumble out and wake up the residents on a regular basis. Our homeless neighbors show more consideration.
The SFPD claim that they are too busy responding to more serious issues, but I find it hard to believe that they would allow this type of behavior to perpetuate without intervention in Pacific Heights.
author: Stephanie C.

description: My favorite bar in the city. The bartenders are hot, sweet and pour a nice stiff drink. The photo booth can not be missed. I have many a photo strip displayed on my fridge with smooching, boobs, and smiles. The robotic arm machine ( you know the one you try to pick up goodies with) often has porn and dildos as the prizes. Pinball also there. Jukebox is full of awesome tunes. They will play skate videos or even Jane Fonda work out videos, on request.They often have themed nights too. Last Saturday was 80's hair metal night. Lots of spandex and big hair with Spinal Tap on the tv. I love this place.
author: Rhiannon C.

description: Pop's deserves much more lovin' from me. I've only been there a couple of times but mark my words, I will see and be seen here more often. Impossible to beat $2 Tecates (with a hole punched in the top for a more favorable sipping experience), old school punk rock DJ, and dogs. Pop's canine customers are the shit. I once saw a dog sitting on a stool, paws on the bar, and straight up chilling. Need I say more?
author: Susan L.

description: Too many hipsters.  Everyone there was hipper than me and staring me down like i didn't belong and probably would have totally beat me up if I didn't go home and put on a hipper shirt and pants, which I did.  Then everything calmed down and I knew what it was like to be hip.  It was crazy, there was a dj playing hipster music that sounded like black sabbath or something.  Everyone was all smelly and had skateboards and those that didn't have skateboards probably rode their fixed gear bikes there. I bet all of them lived around the corner or something and just rode their bike there to show off or something. I ordered a pbr and then realized most of the hipsters there were drinking high life and i felt stupid. I had fun.
author: Ryan J.

description:
pop's has all the elements of a great bar. cheap drinks, window nooks (i'm a sucker for window nooks) and eye candy (for better or for worse, i'm also a sucker for grimy bike messengers.) their jukebox is great for gauging how fucked up you are. if you're scrolling through it thinking it's all crap, you need to drink more. if you're scrolling through it an hour later thinking "fuck yeah! they have lil' kim!" ... well, yeah, you're probably in a good spot.

that tree outside is PRIME for drunken climbing, and if you're really too much of a fuckin' pussy to handle the bathroom, there are lots of alleys and stoops in the immediate vicinity where you can pee. not that i know from experience or anything.
author: Jane P.

description: Yet another one of those establishments that reminds me exactly how old I am. Inevitably I run into someone from RVA (Sometimes it's even someone I  like) every time I end up here. There's usually something interesting going on in the photobooth for all the the voyeurs out there. Do you like to watch?
author: Mingus R.

description:
pop's is a sort of magical bar for me, & really only because it's got a photobooth & half the time i can never find it, which makes getting there mysterious & intriuging. 

"24th & WHAT?! YORK?!! WHERE THE FUCK IS YORK!?!"

& then i have to tromp down the street past mexican homeboys asking me what's up with his car for a ride or what's up with my tits or something, it's like they can tell i am (practically) one of their own, so they think this might work on me. (puerto ricans ain't classy either, lemme just set the record straight. but I AM, so no, it doesn't work on me.) and then, i get there. & proceed to photobooth it up, which is the whole point of this bar if you're asking me, where i always snarl or cover my face with my hands.

hipsters are super annoying. drinks are pretty good. bartenders are pretty sweet. but photobooth pictures are priceless. I LOVE THIS BAR.
author: Irene S.

description: I just can't get excited about Pop's. You know, I will say that it gets the job done if you're looking for a hipster dive bar. The bathrooms are pretty gross.
author: Sarah B.

description: I love Pop's, it's a cozy/divy bar in the Mission that's off the beaten path (I love this part of 24th! Rad independently owned shops. A true neighborhood in the Mission), and the bartenders serve stiff drinks with a smile.
author: Josie B.

description:
it has Hamms ...
that sells this place in my book.
and its dark and cozy
what else do you need
go here
author: Alex M.

description: Yeah yeah, talk all the shit you want about hipsters.  Who cares.  Look this place has $1 Hamm's on Wednesday nights.  Do you understand what you are reading?  and $5 PBR pitchers on Tuesday or something.  But, back to the important stuff. $1.  Hamm's.  Wednesday.
author: Katherine K.

description:
Pop's is nice and dark. In a really get part of the city. Great spot to people watch. The bar it self was fun. The bartender Aaron had a great sense of humor and made one of the best dirty martini's I had in days. What a great way to spend a sunday afternoon. It is worth taking the time to Pop into Pop's.

I am not from the city so to find a place to relax be yourself and laugh and drink a good drink is rare but this is the place.
author: Denise J.

description: Been working down the street from here for a while, decided to pop (pun intended) in with some friends.  Had the pleasure to drink $1 beers, Hamm's.  I was so happy.
author: Scott R.

description: A neighborhood dive with an eclectic clientele that includes nearby residents, hipsters, lesbians, and geeks. Among the amenities are an arcade game with Dig-Dug and Ms. Pac-Man, a pool table, an old-fashioned photo booth, a wall-mounted juke box offering a kitschy variety of genres, and vintage kid bikes mounted on the wall. It strikes me as a place where you'd never run into anyone you know, Monica's experience notwithstanding. This is the type of establishment that reinforces my belief that I definitely am not a bar person.
author: Gourmet G.

description: This place has gone on and off the hipster radar so many times I've gotten seasick thinking about it. Question who the F@%K cares?  It's a bar. It has PBR for $2. It has a photobooth. You can go looking like hangover hag and no one will bat an eye. Yeah. I think that covers it.
author: Veronica G.

description: This is a great place to meet up with friends, play some pool and make out in the photo booth!  Good margaritas, friendly bartenders and a slew of friendly regulars, Pops is like an expanded dive bar in a really cute part of the mission.  There's a great selection of classic metal in the box, so bring plenty o' quarters!
author: Anne C.

description: Great jukebox!  SUPER friendly bartenders! Good little neighborhood bar with good late night specials (bud bottles $1.50 the last time I was there)...  but, it smells like sweat and it can get REALLY loud!  I got used to the smell after a half hour, but I'm NOT a real snooty-pants...  sensitive prissy noses beware.
author: Erica S.

description: Just another hipster mission bar that serves up some ripe "naughty sauce"... eh.. NDB.
author: Katelin H.

description: Sausagefest and phonebooth freaks aside, this is one of my favorite bars in the REAL Mission (as my homey likes to say). can't get any better with a place like St. Francis Fountain and tons of taquerias, pupuserias, bakeries and cafes nearby. come to think of it, not sure what one of the other reviewers was talking about 'cos i always see a fair share of members of the opposite sex up in this joint, as well. they even allow actual intelligent sentient beings (dogs) to watch over the confluence of inebriated humans. woof!
author: Chris C.

description: Went here for karaoke one night. Granted...I was wasted before I walked in the door. It's cool cause you get to sing a whole bunch of songs, but the KJ guy totally let some random chick who I didn't even know grab the other mic and take over my song while I was singing it! What the fuck? I was pissed. Let's have some standards people. Too many hipsters trying to impress their friends!
author: Audrey K.

description: Ok, so this could just be a typical Mission dive with all the standard amenities: cheap drinks, hipster vibe, pool table, great jukebox (all major pluses) BUT what makes this place stand out above the rest is the old-school photoboth in the back... great for documentation of drunken laughs and good times.
author: Shayna N.

description: great neighborhood atmosphere. cool photobooth, 90's alt./ hip hop music. excellent movies on silent.  and there is a special EVERY night! I'm all about that. I would definitely make it a destination if you are in the mood for a chill dive bar
author: Jaide F.

description:
you know that sign outside pop's that reads "please keep it down. respect our neighbors"?  well, i'm the neighbor they're talking about on that sign.  

pop's is a great place to stop in for a beer.  sometimes there's free food and that's always a plus.  they also have good stuff on tap and really reasonable prices.  

BUT there are frequently fights and screaming matches. it's not that hard.  don't drink to the point where you feel the need to punch things (or people).
author: Melissa Y.

description: This is such a cool place, my bf lives right around the corner, which makes it an ideal cheap place to get strong drinks after a stressful day at work. The prices are nice, the music selection at the jukebox is pretty eclectic and bartenders are pretty good. It's like a hipster dive bar, everyone that goes in are pretty friendly for the most part and I love the fact that people can bring their dogs into the bar. Oh and the bacon Mondays, definitely make it a unique place to tell people about.
author: Rebecca D.

description: my favorite local bar... I would describe it as dive/hipster, but anyone would probably enjoy it. The bartenders are totally cool, friendly but with the requisite Mission haircuts. They've got a pool table, a stuffed animal/claw machine with porn, and, my favorite, a b+w photobooth.
author: Cyrelle D.

description: Uber hipster Mission scene. But also, oddly enough, the regulars I know from 'the corridor' can also be found here. Some hot, young eye candy too. Last time we were quite entertained by a silly street fight. Testosterone flows as freely as the taps here.
author: Colleen B.

description: It's dark, it's kinda sticky , the table I sit at is wobbly.  But who cares?  Not me because you can get loaded for about $5.  $1 cans of Hamms on Wednesdays is my favorite.
author: matthew w.

description: I like meeting people here for drinks on off nights (when it's not crowded).  I'm not compulsively cool enough to drink PBR, and get by with Guinness.
author: Tom H.

description: Ditto on the stiff drinks and awesome prices. Every night has a special and theyve got an awesome jukebox. They also have- no joke- the best photo booth in the city. Its the old black and white kind where you always look good, no matter how goofy and drunk you are. This is pretty much my favorite bar to hang out and be comfy in. But warning- it gets a bit too cool for school if you know what I mean. I say if theres 8 or less track bikes out front go in and get blitzed. If there is 9 or more, go to treat street instead.
author: Taler C.

description: I'm just going to come out and say it -- I'm not hip or cool. It's true. Maybe that's why I felt a tiny bit out of place at Pops where most of the regular patrons have a hipper than thou attitude. However, they DO have $5 PBR pitchers on Tuesdays and I did meet a few nice non-regulars who did not seem to mind that I am in no way cool.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I don't ride a fixed gear and I don't have tattoos. I'm not a hipster. According to these reviews, my lack of American Apparel street-cred was going to make this one HELL of an awful experience. Fortunately, I ignored all of that and went anyway. It was either totally awesome or I was just drunk, which made it totally awesome. I had cheap beer ($1) and took drunken photobooth photos ($3) and chatted merrily with some people I didn't know. Being drunk made this quite a cheery experience. I'm going back... for suuuuure. HEEEEEEELL yeah.
author: Jessie A.

description: This bar is far enough away from the beaten path of Mission Street to ensure that most hipsters will find it too inconvenient to stop by for their bar crawl.  They feature insanely cheap drink specials (Tuesday $5 pitcher of Pabst, Wednesday $1 Hamm's beer, $2 well shots/domestic draft for Happy Hour, etc.), the occasional punk/metal DJ at night, a cool bar staff, pool table, photo booth, and a table top arcade game.  The crowd is almost totally comprised of skaters and bike messengers.  No pretense here.
author: Rick E.

description:
i haven't bothered to trudge through all the talk about this place, but it's a winner in my book 'cause you can get hellaciously loud and retarded and no one cares. true it's full of fixed-gear frauds and dirty dogs but it still rips. i went in dressed like a corporate square once after some heiress party and no one really gave a shit. 

as i scan the reviews to the right while yelping, i guess melissa has a point. i don't smoke, and i like to fight inside the bar, so i'm not really bugging her or the other neighbors. anyhow, twice now i've seen clothing models for obscure dotcoms (http://www.flickr.com/photos/b3nsf/410906725/) - those guys are kooks though.
author: ultra p.

description:
really, this review is for the photo booth. it has GREAT contrast. best that i've seen in the city so far. but half the time it doesn't work right. oh well.
love the photobooth.
be the photobooth....
author: Jes M.

description:
granted this place is a block from my house...but can you really ask for more? cheap ass beer, pool table, nice bartenders. more: dogs, photobooth and skaters for those who want to be cool. the windows seem to get broken all the time, but it provides needed ventilation. 
pop's, please don't change....
author: Zhenya S.

description: They have champange in a can!  That is great!  (the soffia coppola cans with straws).
author: Lita F.

description: Pop's is a little bit of a trek from the bart station.  I live in glen park, so I usually only come out to pop's if I've got my bike with me.  I then proceed to lock it up outside, walk across the street, buy tecate, and brown bag it outside.  I don't think I give pop's 4 stars, I think I'm actually giving the sidewalk in front of pop's 4 stars.
author: Matt N.

description: Nothing special--not amazing, not terrible. I've heard it's really popular 'cause they serve minors. But I heard that from a competitor, so go figure.
author: A. M.

description: Living down the street became a hard lesson for booze and boys. Harmony rocks! and Doggys can come inside!
author: Missy I.

description: Pops is fun shit. I usually stumble here already bombed after being at the Phone Booth and always have fun, strong drinks, dirty hot boys....what more could you want. Doesnt matter who I bring here, everyone has fun and always brings out our inner coke whore for some reason and gets rowdy. There a few bars you know will always be bad in a good way and this always is. I always act up when I am here, do shots with guys who wear tighter pants than I do and meet sone super nice bartender with good feathered hair.
author: kelly M.

description:
A true shithole, but I love it. Excellent drink specials, but not always the most fun to be at late at night. Depending on the night it will be filled entirely with easy girls or a bunch of drunk, douchebag hipster guys who picked the wrong night.

I've found it's a much better bar during the day when it isn't so crowded. It's got a decent jukebox and is a pretty nice place to play a few games of pool at 2pm.
author: blimp w.

description: It's alright man.... on a Tuesday at 6pm. This is another bar I always end up at because my friends want to go there. Apparently I had a pretty good time here on my 21st birthday too... I mean I dont really remember, but there is some photographic evidence. I've recently had some pretty bad experiences there involving bad music and people throwing beer cans in my general direction. Way better than Beauty Bar, but not as good as Casanova. There is a photobooth!
author: katharine s.

description: The photo booth made me happy, the vodka soda I had was all vodka, little to no soda. But since my friend got hit by a van while we were trying in vain to find a cab, and then the van sped away, and then a guy on a motorcycle chased after it to get the license plate number, and then the cops came, took one look at my Banana Republic shoes, and said "You must not come here often", I decided that would be my last trip. My friend is fine, but her adorable tights were ruined.
author: Noelle Q.

description: It is a dive bar for sure but, a good one. The bartenders are cool, they make yummy strong drinks, for cheep money. For $3 you can go into the photo booth and get somepics taken, they are always great to see the morning after with your hangover from having way to many cheep but, strong drinks lol Parking was easy, tons of it all around the area. It was fun, and young crowd that was super friendly!! I will be back.
author: Heather L.

description: They wouldnt let me in. It was like 1.30... The funk? Negative 2 bitches! Anway I've visited this spot a couple of times and the last time some drunk lady tried to fight me and her lady friend tried to steal my bike.  But I ain't no hipster wanna-be so after a conversation and slappin some ass I was on my way.
author: riz l.

description: OK, so it's not as easy to get to as, say, Elbo Room, Delirium or Casanova -- but Pop's is way better because it's not as crowded. It's got a decent spread of beer and all the little extras that matter, too: hooks under the bar and on the bathroom door, and a photo booth.
author: Amy Z.

description: A barrio staple and a bar loaded with social extravaganza. A metal-hop loaded jukebox, burgertime and other Miday classics and $1 PBR on happy hour. They have metal vs hip-hop smackdown nights and the most tagged bathrooms I've ever seen. Yes, it's a bar, and I like it, a lot.
author: Dario B.

description: The kind of dive every uppity neighborhood needs. Cheap drinks in an expensive city. It also comes equipped with a pool table, photo booth and plenty of drunken youth to gaze at.
author: Sherry D.

description: I really like the feel of this place.  It seems like there are lots of regulars, and everyone who works there seems cool and nice.  Great drink specials (well drinks are CHEEEAAAP during happy hour) and a nice selection of bottle and draft beers.  There's a pool table and a vintage Pac-Man game, and always interesting TV.  Once they were playing some crazy 80s aerobics tape which seemed perfect against the hip tunes coming from the jukebox.  Very surreal.
author: Casey S.

description: Went here last night with my sister. Was surprised at how cheap a shot was. Wasn't very many people in there, and we were able to talk to each other without too much shouting which was nice. Also the bartender was hot and I very much enjoyed looking at him while my sister and friends played "photo hunt" at the end of the bar.  Told my sister she going to randomly see me hanging out in this bar, even though I don't really drink. Too bad its a 40ish minute drive from where I live.
author: Carissa T.

description:
alright, so pop's gets a lot of flack.

yes, there are hipsters. yes, the music is loud. yes, there is a pretty regular crowd that shows up. yes, there is always someone doing coke in the bathroom. 

but c'mon--the drinks are c-h-e-a-p and strong. they'll put a little hair on your chest. the bartenders are always nice, and showing up for happy hour is great for a conversation and a bloody mary. 

i tend to go to pop's late in my evening and stumble down the street, mauling anyone or thing that gets in my way. i apologize if i have ever stomped on you in effort to order as many drinks as possible knowing that last call is quickly approaching: i surely didn't mean it and more than likely was not aware.
author: Kayla K.

description: Parking sucks. Very small place. Lots of skaters. LOVE the photo booth and table games. And $2 tall cans on thursdays. So its okay.
author: Megan M.

description: Go on Wednesday.  Wear tats.  Don't make fun of people that don't (me)...and get cheap Hamm's.  There's a good picture booth, pool table, and beer can stack.  The music is great, and there is usually a classic or good movie on the tele.  Don't puke on my car...I live three doors down.  When you get drunk, check out the murals across the street.  I'm not a punk rocker as much as these hardcore junkies, and I don't like dive bars that much...but I have fun at Pops.
author: Ben H.

description: I had a downright delightful date here one afternoon with my main squeeze.  Is there another place in San Francisco where you can hustle a game of pool, take some kissy pics in a photo booth and rock the juke box?  If that's not enough, tilt the pinball machine, drink a $1 Hamms and show the world you've got class.
author: imitura ..

description: I often drop in Friday nights before my show on Pirate Cat Radio. Love the beer selection (start with an Anchor, finish with a PBR) and the bar tenders (Jesus hessian and his sexy sidekick), but hate the jackass in the Pac Man shirt who is inevitably bouncing around the pool table. Also, they don't mind if I'm high. Hit me up for a request...I might be just tilted enough to play something for you an hour later.
author: DJ Yuri G.

description: Nice bar with daily specials.  Check the board for their happy hour stuff.  Can get a great buzz really cheap!!
author: Richard F.

description: Pops is the equivalent to finding your favorite piece of furniture on the side of the road. The best damn trash you'll find, and you know  you're going to cherish it forever.  miss it.
author: angie n.

description:
Pop's has everything you could possibly need... pool, jukebox, photo booth, free bacon on Mondays apparently. They have drink specials every night; last I went was a Friday and there were $2 well drinks until 9. In a town that can be stingy with its happy hours, that's a heckuva deal.

People need to get over the stigmatizing things as 'hipster'. What are you so afraid of anyway?
author: Kate F.

description: good bar. good jukebox. lots of parking. good bbq. good theme nights ie bacon night. smells funny.
author: Kelle K.

description: i like pops. there are lots of homos and hipsters there.
author: Eli F.

description: the $1 beers on wednesdays is worth the trek to pops to engage in some pseudo-scentific modern anthropological research with yet another migrant white-people faction of san francisco.
author: christopher a.

description: At the time of this writing, Pop's had a total of 66 Yelp reviews. This actually surprised me, given my initial reaction was something along the lines of, "What? No love for Pop's?" But then I realized that this was more of a blessing in disguise considering the popularity of that other bar on 16th & Albion that every decent person quit going to years ago (175 and counting). Either Pop's manages to stay off the Mission bar-hopping radar or most of the people that come here don't own computers. One thing's for sure though; it's pretty hard budgeting for one when you've blown your entire life savings on a $3000 track bike that hasn't seen a day at the velodrome in its life. Which is part of the irony here too on a certain night of the week when people flock here for  dollar Hamm's. But I'm not going to talk too much shit, the bartenders are attentive and courteous despite the all too frequent run-in with a coked out patron. And it's also deep enough in the Mission to discourage the occasional yuppie intent on slumming it for an evening. Don't come here hungry though, that bakery next door is already hard at work while you're drinking your life away. And I guess they don't take well to laser-pointing your favorite pastries from outside the window either.
author: Jenn W.

description: i like it here. the bartenders are cool. one skates. the girl who works there is sweet. she made me this perfect lemonade kinda drink. they play cool videos like top gun and skate videos. the juke box has wu tang. so pops gets an extra star or 2 just for that. they also have dr. dre up in the mix. its in the mission, close to st francis and the skate park so the location is perfect. oh and its really cheap! there's a photo booth and pool table too. fun place to hang out after skating the park.
author: Jo L.

description: A great bar if you want to get laid by a limp dicked alcoholic who has lots of attitude for zero (and probably a girlfriend he's cheating on to boot!).  Not a "deep thinker" hang out.  don't be surprised to hear racial slurs here - I have. pretentious EMO rich kids slumming in the mission in between getting their first heroin habit.  wannabe bike messengers.  Hey people, fixed gear bikes are good for two things - parts and riding on the indoor wooden Velodrome track in France.  Riding them around to look cool is stupid and dangerous (but you've probably found that out already in a faceplant).  You need really strong calves to handle a fixed gear since there are no coaster breaks (not skinny chicken legs like most of the specimens have at Pop's).  If you're a pretty young girl don't expect to get served anytime soon by one of the female bartenders unless your cute boyfriend orders for you.   Oh, and you can get mugged right out in front and no one will help! Fun!  Check out the Parkside, Bottom of the Hill or Deluxe instead.  One note though, the dyke bartenders there are HOT!
author: jane d.

description: I heard this was a hot spot but I walked in and it smelled so strong of dirty feet I had to leave...so I may never know unless they get some odor eaters up in there
author: hungry b.

description: i like pops. i go there when my friends arent 86'ed from there, but i tend to stay away from pops on wednesdays  and weekends, unless its early, and every bartender there gives me my whiskey in a pint glass while all those who are below me get the little one for the same price. bow down bitches.
author: Greasy w.
